text: UAAP Baby Tams, three other teams try to start streaksDO IT AGAIN.Games on Saturday at the Filoil Flying V Centre10:00 AM  Adamson vs UST12:00 PM  DLSZ vs NU2:00 PM  UPIS vs Ateneo4:00 PM  UE vs FEU-DilimanDefending champion Far Eastern University-Diliman and top challenger Ateneo de Manila High School are headed toward a head-on collision in the UAAP 80 Juniors Basketball Tournament.Before that happens, however, they two teams will first have to take care of business against separate opponents on Saturday at the Filoil Flying V Centre.L-Jay Gonzales and the Baby Tamaraws go for back-to-back wins to begin their title defense at the expense of revamped University of the East at 4:00 PM.Also looking for a second straight win are SJ Belangel, Kai Sotto, and the Blue Eaglets who are pitted against neighboring University of the Philippines Integrated School at 2:00 PM.A week from those assignments, FEU-Diliman will wage war anew with Ateneo.For now, though, those two teams arent the only playoff hopefuls seeking to go streaking.Nazareth School of National University looks to build on its dominant season-opening win when it takes on young and hungry De La Salle Zobel at 12:00 PM.Meanwhile, University of Sto. Tomas is also hoping that it can sustain its strong start to the season when it does battle with new-look Adamson High School at 10:00 AM.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @riegogogo.
title: Baby Tams, three other teams try to start streaks

text: UAAP NU claims breakthrough men's taekwondo crownNational University already has the UAAP men's taekwondo title in the bag.National University virtually clinched its first-ever men's title with a 6-1 win over traditional powerhouse University of Sto. Tomas Friday in the UAAP Season 80 taekwondo tournament at the Blue Eagle Gym.Undefeated in five bouts, the Bulldogs will still emerge as champions even if they drop their final elimination round assignment. NU is still fighting Far Eastern University as of posting time.University of the Philippines wound up with a 4-2 record following a 7-0 blanking of a shorthanded University of the East side.The Fighting Maroons can still savage second place if the Bulldogs beat the Tamaraws in their final elims bout.The Growling Tigers fell at 3-2 with one bout remaining against the Red Warriors. Even with a win over UE and ends up in joint second with UP, UST will finish third by virtue of winner-over-the-other rule.The Lady Bulldogs, meanwhile, moved closer in claiming a back-to-back crown after a 6-1 victory over the Tigresses.Also sporting a spotless 5-0 card, NU can wrap up the crown with a victory over UP.The Lady Maroons, who hold a 4-1 card, will clinch the title if they topple the Lady Bulldogs, while a loss will give the Diliman-based jins a runner-up finish.UST fell in a tie with Ateneo, a 6-1 winner over FEU, at 3-2, as the Tigresses and the Lady Eagles were fighting for third place.
title: NU claims breakthrough men's taekwondo crown

text: UAAP NU, UST eye Finals rematch in girls volleyballNational University will try to advance in the Finals for the fifth straight year.Reigning girls champion National University and archrival University of Sto. Tomas hope to seal another title duel as they faced lower ranked foes in the UAAP Season 80 high school volleyball Final Four Friday at the Filoil Flying V Centre.The Bullpups take on fourth-ranked Far Eastern-University at 11:00 a.m., while the Junior Tigresses battle No. 3 De La Salle-Zobel at 9:30 a.m.Holding twice-to-beat bonus for finishing top two in the eliminations, NU and UST need only to win once to make it to the best-of-three Finals for the fifth straight year.The Bullpups foiled the Junior Tigresses' sweep bid with a 25-20, 25-15, 26-24 win over the weekend. NU tied UST at 11-1, but the Bustillos-based spikers took the No. 1 ranking by virtue of a superior quotient.The Junior Lady Spikers wound up third in the elims with a 7-5 card, while the Baby Tamaraws finished fourth with an even 6-6 card.NU and UST dispute the remaining twice-to-beat incentive in the boys' Final Four at 8:00 a.m. The Bullpups and the Tiger Cubs ended up tied in second place at the end of double-round eliminations at 11-3.FEU-Diliman, which finished the eliminations with the league-best record at 12-2 card, take on University of the East (10-4) in the Final Four starting at 8:00 a.m. on Sunday.
title: NU, UST eye Finals rematch in girls volleyball

text: UAAP NU jins still unscathed in UAAP 80 TaekwondoThe NU men's taekwondo jins remained undefeated after four bouts in UAAP Season 80.National University stayed perfecr in both divisions, moving closer to its first-ever golden double on Thursday in the UAAP Season 80 taekwondo tournament at the Blue Eagle Gym.The back-to-back title-seeking Lady Bulldogs followed up their 6-1 win over University of the East Wednesday with a 7-0 shutout of Far Eastern University for a spotless 3-0 card.Gunning for its first-ever men's crown, NU beat University of the Philippines, 6-1, and Ateneo, 7-0, in succession to stay undefeated in four bouts.FEU is also unbeaten in men's action with a 2-0 slate following last Wednesday's narrow 4-3 victory over UP.University of Santo Tomas seized solo second as it primed up to its much-anticipated duel with NU today which could be the women's title decider with a 5-2 victory over long-time rival De La Salle.In the morning session, the Tigresses, who now sport a 3-1 slate, scored a quick 7-0 victory over the Lady Tamaraws.UP overwhelmed UE, 6-1, to improve at 2-1 in third place in the other distaff side match. De La Salle, meanwhile, has lost two straight after winning its two opening day fights to fell in fourth spot.In the other men's morning bouts, titleholder Growling Tigers nipped Ateneo, 4-3, for a 2-1 card while the Green Jins toppled UE, 6-1, to enter the win column after a 0-2 start.
title: NU jins still unscathed in UAAP 80 Taekwondo

text: Volleyball Cargo Movers remain unscathed, sweep LifesaversAby Marano of F2 Logistics pounds an attack against Generika-Ayala's Chloe Cortez and Angeli Araneta.Games Saturday:(De La Salle Lipa Sentrum)4:00 p.m. -- Foton vs Sta. Lucia6:00 p.m. -- Victoria Sports-UST vs F2 LogisticsF2 Logistics kept its unbeaten record intact with a straight sets demolition of Generika-Ayala, 25-21, 25-17, 25-17, Thursday in the 2017 Chooks to Go-Philippine Superliga Grand Prix at the Filoil Flying V Centre in San Juan.The Cargo Movers captured their fourth win in as many outings to tighten its grip of the top spot despite a sluggish start.Sabi ko lang naman tiyagain lang at dumepensa kasi naglalakas ng serve yung Generika-Ayala and at the same time medyo magulo nung una yung set ni (Kim) Fajardo, said F2 Logistics coach Ramil de Jesus. Hindi sila magkaintindihan nung import, di ko alam kung kulang sa communication pero minsan inaamin naman ng import na mali niya.Venezuelan import Maria Jose Perez and American reinforcement Kennedy Bryan poured 14 points each and combined for 24 of the Cargo Movers 38 attack points.Aby Marano and Kim Kianna Dy scored six markers each while Fajardo tallied 20 excellent sets.The Lifesavers dropped to 2-4 slate.Croatian import Katarina Pilepic was the only Generika-Ayala player in double figures with 11 points while Darlene Ramdin of Trinidad and Tobago was limited to only five points.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Cargo Movers remain unscathed, sweep Lifesavers

text: Volleyball Cocolife evens record to 3-3, adds woes to Iriga CityAmerican import Taylor Milton of Cocolife penetrates the defense of Iriga City.Games Saturday:(De La Salle Lipa Sentrum)4:00 p.m. -- Foton vs Sta. Lucia6:00 p.m. -- Victoria Sports-UST vs F2 LogisticsCocolife turned to American imports Taylor Milton and Tai Manu-Olevao in the tight third set to stave off the gritty Iriga City, 25-23, 25-15, 26-24, in the 2017 Chooks to Go-Philippine Superliga Grand Prix at the Filoil Flying V Centre in San Juan Thursday.The duo banged in crucial hits in the clutch to douse cold water on the torrid fightback from the Lady Oragons as the Asset Managers collected their third win in six outings.With the win, Cocolife formally barged into the top four behind unbeaten F2 Logistics, Petron (5-1) and Foton (4-1) as the tourney enters the crucial stretch of the single-round eliminations.Milton hammered 19 kills to close the match with 20 points while Manu-Olevao knocked down 16 kills, two blocks and an ace in a 19-point outing for the Asset Managers.Kay Iriga anytime na mag-relax ka tutuhugin ka eh, said Cocolife coach Kungfu Reyes. Yung third set nag-struggle kami buti na lang naka-recover.True enough, the Lady Oragons were tough nuts to crack.After pummeling Iriga City in the first two sets, the Asset Managers were comfortably ahead, 18-11, in third before the Lady Oragons gave a scary rally.Behind the hot smashes of Japanese Saama Miyagawa and Serbian Tamara Kmezic and their steady reception, Iriga City engineered a furious fightback to knot the match at 20, pushing the Asset Managers on the verge of a potential fourth set.Iriga City finally took the lead, 24-23, but Milton delivered back-to-back hits to steal the match point, 25-24.Then, Kath Villegas was assessed with an attack error, giving the victory to the Asset Managers.Kmezic finished with 13 kills and two blocks for 16 points while Miyagawa chipped in 10 markers for the Lady Oragons, who absorbed their fourth straight setback after opening the conference with an impressive win over Sta. Lucia Realty.
title: Cocolife evens record to 3-3, adds woes to Iriga City

text: Volleyball BVR back on tour with stop at Surigao del SurAfter taking a mini break, Beach Volleyball Republic is back with a fresh stop for its 2017 tour. (BVR)After taking a mini break, Beach Volleyball Republic is back with a fresh stop for its 2017 tour.BVR starts its year-end push at Surigao del Sur for a two-day joust on Nov. 17-18 featuring 12 teams in the women's division.Perlas will have a pair of teams on deck with Bea Tan teamming up with Dzi Gervacio while Amy Ahomiro will play with Gizelle Tan.Other pairs seeing action are Jane Trinidad and Guen Cabrera of Holy Cross of Davao College, Ildecres Ayad and Vanessa Andoque of Jose Maria College, Dana Me Pingos and Mayla Casinao of Cagayan de Oro, Jojefe Flores and Aimee Laurete of Dipolog, Grace Barrica and Liezel Elcamel of Zamboanga Del Norte, and Cris Asena and Angela Quisado of UM Tagum.Players from Singapore will also compete with Ong Wei Yu and Eliza Chong Hui Hui making up one team while Tan Shiang Theng will play with BVR regular Amanda Villanueva.PNP Tagum, with 2017 national champions Karen Quilario and Lourdilyn Catubag, were also supposed to play but had to back out at the last minute. The two teams will be replaced.Action will start Friday at the Grand Ola Resort.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @paullintag8
title: BVR back on tour with stop at Surigao del Sur

text: Volleyball Petron puts a blemish on Foton, wins back-to-backAmerican import Hilary Hurley of Petron unleashes a crosscourt attack to elude the net defense of Foton.Games Thursday:(Filoil Flying V Centre)4:15 p.m.  Cocolife vs Iriga City7:00 p.m.  Generika-Ayala vs F2 LogisticsPetron outgunned erstwhile unbeaten archrival defending champion Foton, 25-21, 25-22, 12-25, 25-20, Tuesday in the 2017 Chooks to-Go-Philippine Superliga (PSL) Grand Prix at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.American import Lindsay Stalzer did most of the damage for the Blaze Spikers as she led Petron to its second straight win against her former team in a rematch of last years Finals.Stalzer hammered 20 attacks in her 23-point outing while reinforcement Hilary Hurley scored 20 points with 15 coming off kills including the match-clinching crosscourt spike to end the one-hour, 55-minute encounter.Petron improved to 5-1 win-loss record while handing the Tornadoes their first loss after a four-game winning streak.Sobra naming inaral ito, honestly speaking, yun naman kasi ang kailangan and lahat naman ng kalaban namin grabe din namin inaaral, said Blaze Spikers coach Shaq delos Santos.Petron cruised in the first two sets but were pummeled by Foton led by Serbian import Sara Klisura in the third before staving off the Tornadoes repeated comeback attempt in the fourth frame.Even though natalo kami ng third set, naging challenge parin para sa amin, said Delos Santos. Sabi ko nga sa kanila, kalimutan niyo na yung third set. Ang kailangang nasa mind natin ay kung ano ang ginawa natin sa first two sets, which is all-out (yung laro).Petron built a 20-11 cushion only to see the Foton with Klisura and Jaja Santiago spark a rally to close in 23-19. But a miss communication by the Tornadoes on their reception put Petron at match point in the next play.Stalzer overcooked her serve but Hurley sealed the deal with his crosscourt winner.Klisura had 29 points while Santiago added 11 markers for the Tornadoes. Montenegrin reinforcement Dragana Perunicic had a quiet night with only six points.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Petron puts a blemish on Foton, wins back-to-back

text: Volleyball Lady Realtors end slump, whip Tigresses in three setsUkrainian reinforcement Bodhana Anisova of Sta. Lucia Realty spikes an attack over the outstretched arms of Japanese import Yukie Imamaso and Shanen Palec of Victoria Sports-UST.Games Thursday:(Filoil Flying V Centre)4:15 p.m.  Cocolife vs Iriga City7:00 p.m.  Generika-Ayala vs F2 LogisticsSta. Lucia Realty finally long drought as the Lady Realtors schooled Victoria Sports-University of Santo Tomas, 25-19, 25-21, 25-19, Tuesday in the 2017 Chooks to-Go-Philippine Superliga (PSL) Grand Prix at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.The Lady Realtors gifted head coach Jerry Yee his first win in the league after dropping their first three games.Ukranian reinforcement Dana Anisova led SLRs assault with 13 points anchored on 11 attacks while Canadian Marisa Field and local star Pam Lastimosa chipped in 11 markers apiece for the Lady Realtors.Rialen Sante added nine points while Rebecca Rivera tallied 20 excellent sets for SLR.Still, Yee was from satisfied with their win against the collegiate squad.Madami pa rin kaming errors and lapses then, hindi pa rin nagko-connect ang setter at middle hitters natin, he said pointing at their 23 errors. Buti nalang nandiyan yung ibang imports natin na kayang-kaya yung outside hits.Ang hirap noon kapag natalo pa kami. So, kahit papaano may konting pressure doon. We needed a win so we got a win, he added. Ito ang mga baby steps namin so well take it.Dimdim Pacres scored nine points while Carla Sandoval and Caitlyn Viray tallied eight markers each for the Golden Tigresses, who remained listless in three outings.
title: Lady Realtors end slump, whip Tigresses in three sets

text: Basketball Kobe says Kai Sotto should consider going to school in the USFrom one next-gen talent to another.From one next-gen talent to another.Kobe Paras, the 20-year-old Filipino basketball prodigy who is trying his luck in the United States, has some advice to young Kai Sotto.Kai is the 15-year-old Filipino basketball prodigy starring for the Ateneo Blue Eaglets in the UAAP. He is also 7'1".Posting on his Twitter account, Paras says that Kai hopefully makes the "mature" choice soon and take his talents to the US.I was 15 years old when I moved out here in LA.Hopefully one day Kai may make a mature decision to continue his basketball career here in the states so that he won't get rotten and brained washed in Manila. Endless opportunities available here for that young bull... https://t.co/SeHteNEHyF  Kobe | koko wave  (@_kokoparas) November 16, 2017The son of PBA legend Benjie added that he was around the same age as Kai when he chose to leave his family in the Philippines to try and carve out a career on the other side of the world.Paras had a pretty good high school career in Los Angeles, making him a three-star recruit that initially landed him at UCLA in the same class as Lonzo Ball.He transferred to Creighton but didn't see much playing time in his freshman season. His NCAA Division 1 journey now continues at Cal State Northridge.Sotto, who just towers over everybody in the Philippines, is just starting his second high school season in the UAAP.In his first game last week, a dominant Ateneo win, he played 23 minutes off the bench and recorded 24 points, 12 rebounds, and seven blocks.He's definitely going to be a hot commodity once he's ready to play college ball although if Kobe is to ask, Kai should definitely consider honing his talents in the US.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @paullintag8
title: Kobe says Kai Sotto should consider going to school in the US

text: Basketball Trump urges 3 UCLA players to thank China leader for releaseUCLA head coach Steve Alford, right, listens as Jalen Hill reads his statement during a news conference at UCLA Wednesday, Nov. 15, 2017, in Los Angeles. Three UCLA NCAA college basketball players accused of shoplifting in China admitted to the crime and apologized before coach Steve Alford announced they were being suspended indefinitely. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong)WASHINGTON (AP)  President Donald Trump urged three suspended UCLA basketball players on Thursday to thank China's president for their freedom after they shoplifted in China.The president's suggestion came a day after he tweeted: "Do you think the three UCLA basketball players will say thank you President Trump. They were headed for 10 years in jail."The trio apologized that day and publicly thanked Trump, who was in Asia last week, for his help. On Thursday morning, the president sent another tweet: "You're welcome. go out and give a big Thank You to President Xi Jinping of China who made your release possible."In the same tweet, Trump said, "HAVE A GREAT LIFE! Be careful, there are many pitfalls on the long and winding road of life!"Later in the day, as he rallied House Republicans before a crucial vote on a tax overhaul, Trump talked about his efforts to release the playersRep. Steve Womack of Arkansas said Trump "personally engaged the Chinese president and it turned out the way it did," with the players released. He said China is known for being "extremely punitive" with criminal suspects, adding: "This could have been a disaster for those families."Freshmen LiAngelo Ball, Jalen Hill and Cody Riley were detained in Hangzhou for questioning last week before the Bruins beat Georgia Tech in their season-opening game in Shanghai. The rest of the team returned home Saturday.Athletic director Dan Guerrero said the shoplifting occurred when the team had 90 minutes of free time on Nov. 6 in Hangzhou. He said the three took items from three stores.The players are suspended indefinitely, and coach Steve Alford says they will have to earn their way back onto the team.
title: Trump urges 3 UCLA players to thank China leader for release

text: Basketball Gilas dominates ROS in tune-up marred by brawlDespite a lopsided win against the Elasto Painters, it didn't come easy for Gilas as a brawl involving Carl Bryan Cruz and Don Trollano marred the first half of the contest.Looks like the isolated camp at Tagaytay did Gilas Pilipinas some good.The national team scored a convincing 96-75 victory Thursday against the Rain or Shine Elasto Painters in a tune-up at Gatorade Hoops in Mandaluyong as part of their preparations for the first windown of the FIBA World Cup Asian Qualifiers.After a flat performance against Alab Pilipinas barely a week ago resulting in a loss, it seems like Gilas is starting to pick up steam during yet another rushed camp ahead of a major international game.The Philippines opened camp last November 3, exactly three weeks before taking on Japan on the road on November 24. Three days later on November 27, Gilas will host Taipei at the Araneta Coliseum.Despite a lopsided win against the Elasto Painters, it didn't come easy for Gilas as a brawl involving Carl Bryan Cruz and Don Trollano marred the first half of the contest.Still, the game continued and Chot Reyes' crew cruised to a win.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @paullintag8
title: Gilas dominates ROS in tune-up marred by brawl

text: Basketball Blatche finally on his way to Manila?Posting on his Instagram page, Andray Blatche appears to be headed to Manila before the end of this week to reinforce Gilas Pilipinas.Help is on the way for Gilas Pilipinas.With barely a week before the Philippines starts its campaign i nthe FIBA World Cup Asian Qualifiers, naturalized center Andray Blatche is expected to finally arrive and give the national team a boost.Blatche was originally scheduled to arrive last November 12 per head coach Chot Reyes but it seems that the former Brooklyn Net got caught up with previous commitments with the Xinjiang Flying Tigers in th Chinese Basketball Association.However, posting on his Instagram page, Blatche appears to be headed to Manila before the end of this week.Last game tomorrow then headed to Manila sorry for the hold up are season got pushed back but see yal soon A post shared by Andray Blatche (@draylive) on Nov 15, 2017 at 7:43pm PSTBlatche last played for Gilas in the 2017 SEABA Championships back in May, leading the team to an impressive sweep in Manila.He missed the FIBA Asia Cup and was replaced by Christian Standhardinger.Gilas Pilipinas will take on Japan on the road on November 24 before hosting Taipei on November 27 to complete the first window of the first round of the Asian Qualifiers.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @paullintag8
title: Blatche finally on his way to Manila?

text: PVL Soltones sacking absurd  Sports VisionSports Vision, organizer of the Premier Volleyball League, called the Philippine Superliga's one-year ban and P50,000 fine on Grethcel Soltones absurd and uncalled for.Sports Vision, which organizes the Premier Volleyball League, on Tuesday branded Philippine Superligas suspension of Grethcel Soltones as ridiculous, stressing that the PVL top player is not in any way under contract with the PSL and is only on loan to Iriga City team."The suspension and hefty fine on (Gretchel) Soltones by the PSL officials is absurd and totally uncalled for, Sports Vision president Ricky Palou said in a statement.In the first place, Soltones has no contract with the PSL. She is only on loan to the team of Iriga as her mother league is the PVL.Palou also pointed out that the PVL All Star Game is one-day charity event held for the benefit of HERO Foundation, a foundation established to raise scholarship funds for children of soldiers who gave up their lives in the line of duty.I don't see anything wrong with what Gretchel did. In fact she should be commended for helping in this fund raising event by her participation, said Palou.He added that the All-Star event is an annual undertaking staged to benefit a charitable institution or victims of calamities.The PVL All-Star has been scheduled at the start of the 2017 PVL Season even before Soltones has been borrowed by Iriga to play for them.Citing its one-league policy, the PSL on Monday suspended the former San Sebastian star and many-time NCAA MVP for one year and fined her P50,000 for suiting up in the PVL fund-raiser.
title: Soltones sacking absurd  Sports Vision

text: PVL PVL livestream gave us an even bigger audience -- ABS-CBN Integrated Sports head Dino LaurenaThe Premier Volleyball League will be bigger, more exciting and will be brought to a wider scope of audience when the second season opens in the first quarter of 2018.The Premier Volleyball Leagues first season was a resounding success and its three conferences  the Reinforced, Open and Collegiate  drew a huge following not only on the venue and ontelevision but also on digital platform with games shown via livestream carried by ABS-CBN Sports digital arm, sports.abs-cbn.com.Napakaganda ng first season natin, beyond expectations, said ABS-CBN Integrated Sports head Dino Laurena.It just confirms that volleyball is already big among the audiences. Kita naman natin from the first, second and third conferences na walang bitaw ang mga fans natin ng PVL, he added. We are hoping na well continue to grow it now that we are also partnering and using our barangay clinics. Sana lahat ng tao sa ibat ibang lugar mas lalo silang maengganyo sa panonood ng PVL.A new innovation was also offered to PVL fans in its inaugural year where livestream audience were given the power to choose which angle of the action they want to see with the introduction of multi-camera set up.This feature boosted the PVLs popularity that aside from tapping a broader audience base, it brought the league closer to fans through social media.Maganda na nga na sinubukan natin ang livestream kasi alam naman natin, based on our monitoring, na mas nanonood ang mga tao sa kanilang mobile phones. TV, I think, for the most part becomes the second screen eh, Laurena said.Were very happy with that turn of events also kasi siyempre nung sinubukan natin yang livestream parang kapit nga sa patalim yan eh, he added. But in the end it gave us an even bigger audience. Actually habang nagmo-mobile (viewing) sila nagso-social media na rin sila.Without revealing whats in store for the PVLs second season, Laurena vowed to give volleyball fans an even more exciting viewing experience when it opens in the first quarter of 2018.Paplanuhin pa natin yan but we want to make things more fun for the audience, he said. Im sure when we come back theres a lot that we can offer for our audience not just on TV but also on digital and hopefully also on on-ground, sa events.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: PVL livestream gave us an even bigger audience -- ABS-CBN Integrated Sports head Dino Laurena

text: PVL Idols, fans both enjoy every moment of All-Star SundayA male fan is relishing his selfie moment with (from left seated at the table), Ran-Ran Abdilla, Jerrili Malabanan, Creaks Racraquin, and Rex Intal.Volleyball-crazy couple Gerardo and Zenaida Reyes travelled all the way from Tagudin, Ilocos Sur, to come face-to-face with their idols in the featured meet-and-greet attraction of the much-talked about Premier Volleyball League All-Star Sunday, Oct. 29, at Filoil Flying V Centre in San Juan City.The 63-year-old wife, a retired nurse, said she goes gaga over the Ateneo Lady Blue Eagles particularly middle blockers Bea de Leon and Amy Ahomiro, two of 45 PVL stars on hand that bright Sunday to interact with fans, sign autographs, and oblige selfie requests.Her husband, an engineer and six years her junior, belongs to a different breed of fans.He digs every player who is exceptionally talented, be he or she a spiker, setter or libero. Without missing a beat, he rattled off the names of Marck Espejo, Peter Torres, Ish Polvorosa, Vince Mangulabnan, Myla Pablo, Jia Morado, Grethcel Soltones, Diana Mae Carlos, Isa Molde, and many more whose court brilliancies he said takes his breath away.Guarding their positions in a long queue of PVL diehards who each would have a chance at every one of the white-shirted volleyball luminaries seated at blue cloth-covered tables joined end-to-end, Mrs. Reyes was looking forward to getting the autographs of and be photographed with de Leon and Ahomiro.Oh, Mr. Reyes was prepared to make the most of his personal encounters with his heroes and heroines, and there were 45 of them lined up for him.There were the Hashimoto sisters of GMA, Cavite  Nicole, 18, and Yuki, 9  who came with half-sister Pau Franco, 23. The two younger ones couldnt wait to see Jia Morado up close and personal.Businesswoman Cristina Fernando, 47, and a mother of four, arrived with two other companions. She was overly excited at her meet-and-greet moment with Amy Ahomiro.Pat Quiamzon, 18, and younger sibling Tin-Tin, 12, both studying in Paref Woodrose in Ayala, Alabang, came over for Bea de Leon.Who would they encounter first but handsome Tawi-Tawi pride Fauzi Ismail of National University seated beside Grethcel Soltones of PVL Open champion BaliPure?Next at the long table offering what veritably looked like mouth-watering dishes were the good-looking specimens of malehood, Ran-Ran Abdilla of Philippine Air Force and former Ateneo Eagle Rex Intal, who is now with Cignal, book-casing the beautiful pair of Jerrili Malabanan of Far Eastern University and BaliPure and Ceska Racraquin of San Beda College and Creamline.Whoever thought up these seating arrangements of the PVL standouts was a genius, not much unlike a master chef arraying his sumptuous dishes and concoctions in a not-be-outdone presentation.And so Mrs. Reyes, Mrs. Fernando, the Hashimoto sisters, the Quiamzon siblings quickly forgot their original intents of just being contented with seeing their particular volleyball idols.As quick as lightning, they had their selfies with Ismael and Soltones, then with Abdilla, Malabanan, Racraquin and Intal, besides getting their autographs.This was the second straight year that Sports Vision was staging the All-Star games. First-time All-Stars Malabanan, Racraquin, and setter Timothy Tajanlangit of the University of Santo Tomas were tremendously enjoying their share of fans adulation.We feel like we were really celebrities, said Malabanan. Oh you already are, girl, remember that.I like the feeling of interacting with fans, gushed Racraquin. Its a one-of-a-kind feeling. I make them happy and they make me happier.A quiet fellow, Gen. Santos City-born Tajanlangit, was bursting with joy at his selection as an All-Star. I will never forget this moment when fans are getting my autographs besides having selfies with me.Originally set for two hours, the autograph-signing and photo ops lasted for yet over an hour more.Each of the lucky fans went home with a memento or two of this grand spectacle that was the PVL All-Star Sunday.See you next season.
title: Idols, fans both enjoy every moment of All-Star Sunday

text: PVL Team Vhyl and Team Roger victorious in first PVL All-Star SundayTeam Roger Gorayeb Red bested Team Rico De Guzman While in the women's match of the first PVL All-Star Sunday!It was a day to remember for fans and players alike as the Premier Volleyball League (PVL) marked the end of its inaugural season on October 29 with a successful All-Star Sunday that saw Team Vhyl and Team Roger win in the Mens and Womens exhibition matches, respectively.Coach Vhyl Verayo led the Yellow team to a five-set win over coach Oliver Almadros Blue team 25-16, 20-25, 25-22, 23-25, 15-9 behind a balanced attack let by Fauzi Ismail's 14 points. Four other players scored in double figures for Team Yellow, while Marck Espejo and Mark Alfafara led Blue with 16 and 10 points.Meanwhile, coach Roger Gorayebs Team Red prevented a Team White comeback when they ended the womens match in four sets 25-21, 25-22, 13-25, 25-21. Riding on the herculean efforts of Diana Carlos who finished with 15 points, Gorayebs squad held off the rampage of coach Rico De Guzmans wards led by Nicole Tiamzon with 14 points.The other leading scorers for Red were Aiko Urdas with 11 and Kathy Bersola and Amy Ahomiro with nine apiece, while White had Isa Molde and Bea De Leon 12 and 11 points, respectively.The event, held at the San Juan Arena and streamed on premiervolleyballlegue.com, with the womens match airing live on S+A and S+A HD, was for the benefit of the Hero Foundation.Before the games, the fans who have supported the league in all its three conferences this year were treated to a meet and greet with their volleyball idols. Apart from an autograph session with PVL stars, they were also entertained by Star Music artists such as Miko & Gab, Yohan Hwang, and Marlo Mortel.Participants from S+As Heroes Camp Volleyball Clinic, which has gone to six barangays to teach and inspire budding Filipino athletes volleyball fundamentals and positive values, were also present to cheer for and meet their volleyball idols. To close the fun-filled day, the kids also joined the PVL stars in a flash mob dance.Catch the telecasts of the PVL All-Star Sunday games starting with the Mens Division match this Monday (October 30) at 4 pm and the Womens match on Tuesday (October 31) at 6 pm. Both matches can be watched online via premiervolleyballleague.com. For more information and stories, visit ABS-CBNs sports hub sports.abs-cbn.com and follow @ABSCBNSports on Facebook and Twitter.
title: Team Vhyl and Team Roger victorious in first PVL All-Star Sunday

text: PVL Red Team tops White Team in PVL All-Star women's matchPVL All-Star Sunday women's exhibition match participants with kids from Heroes Camp.Diana Carlos had an explosive night, dropping 15 points to power Red Team to a 25-21, 25-22, 13-25, 25-21, triumph over White Team in the Premier Volleyball League All-Star Sunday womens volleyball exhibition match at the FilOil Flying V Centre.The University of the Philippines star unleashed 12 attacks and three service aces for the Roger Gorayeb team in the leagues end of the season fund-raising event for the benefit of Hero Foundation.BaliPure and National University standout Aiko Urdas scored 11 while Amy Ahomiro and Kathy Bersola of BanKo-Perlas finished with nine markers each for the Red Team.Masaya kami, unang-una, kasi ito naman ginawa para sa mga fans ng mga batang ito. Pangalawa, para doon Hero Foundation, 'yung makatulong kami, makabigay kami ng kasiyahan sa mga tao, said Gorayeb, whose squad scored 15 from the service line.Ito na ang soli namin sa suportang binigay nila for the past three conferences at saka very noble 'yung rason ng pagkakaroon nito eh, he added.Tied at 14 in the fourth set, Carlos and Urdas led the Red Teams assault to build a 24-19 separation.Nicole Tiamzon of BanKo-Perlas scored 14 points while UPs Isa Molde and Ateneo De Manilas Bea De Leon chipped in 12 and 11 markers, respectively, for the White Team.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Red Team tops White Team in PVL All-Star women's match

text: PVL Verayo happy to help brothers in arms thru PVL All-Star SundayMalaking pasasalamat namin dito sa Premier Volleyball League kasi nga, as a uniformed personnel, malaki ang naitutulong sa amin ng Hero Foundation -- Air Force staff sergeant Rhovyl Verayo (File photo)More than winning the exhibition match and giving the fans an action-packed performance in the Premier Volleyball League All-Star Sunday, veteran mens volleyball coach Rhovyl Verayo was happy to be a part of the event aimed for a noble cause.The Air Force staff sergeant steered the Yellow Team to a 25-16, 20-25, 25-22, 23-25, 15-9, win over Blue Team at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan in the charity match organized for the benefit of Hero Foundation.The said foundation helps our men in uniform and the orphans of fallen soldiers.Malaking pasasalamat namin dito sa Premier Volleyball League kasi nga, as a uniformed personnel, malaki ang naitutulong sa amin ng Hero Foundation, said Verayo.Berlin Paglinawan caught fire in the deciding set, scoring five points including the match-clinching kill.Fauzi Ismail of Philippine Air Force had 14 points while Jet Spikers teammates Ranran Abdilla, the Reinforced Conference Most Valuable Player, and Kim Malabunga finished with 13 markers each for Yellow Team.Paglinawan played for only three sets but still came up with 11 points while Francis Saura got 11 markers.Marck Espejo led Blue Team with 16 points with all but one coming off kills while Mark Alfafara got 10.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Verayo happy to help brothers in arms thru PVL All-Star Sunday

text: PVL Paglinawan powers Yellow Team past Blue Team in PVL All-StarYellow Team celebrates after scoring against Blue Team in the PVL All-Star Sunday men's exhibition match.Berlin Paglinawan played the heros role for Yellow Team in the fifth set as they turned back the Marck Espejo-led Blue Team, 25-16, 20-25, 25-22, 23-25, 15-9, in the Premier Volleyball League All-Star Sunday at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.The Sta. Elena star, who was tapped by head coach Rhovyl Verayo as team captain, scattered five points in the deciding set including the game-clinching attack to seal the one-hour, 41-minute exhibition match organized to raise fund for the benefit of Hero Foundation.Fauzi Ismail of Philippine Air Force had 14 points while Jet Spikers teammates Ranran Abdilla, the Reinforced Conference Most Valuable Player, and Kim Malabunga finished with 13 markers each for Yellow Team.Paglinawan played for only three sets but still came up with 11 points while Francis Saura got 11 markers.The Yellow Team raced to an early 8-4 lead with Paglinawan leading the assault.Maganda 'yung laban. Diskartehin lang talaga. Lahat ng naglaro is exceptional player naman talaga, said Verayo. Pinili lahat ng magagaling kaya expected na maganda talaga 'yung laban.Espejo led the Oliver Almadro-coached Blue Team with 16 points with all but one coming off kills while Mark Alfafara got 10.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Paglinawan powers Yellow Team past Blue Team in PVL All-Star

text: PVL No holding back as stars collide in PVL All-Star SundaySERIOUS FUN: Expect an action-packed exhibition match and a fun day of activities in the PVL All-Star Sunday.Expect an action-packed exhibition match when the brightest stars of the Premier Volleyball League collide in the PVL All-Star Sunday charity match at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.Creamline top setter Jia Morado vowed that she wont hold back in the action and will bring her A-game as she leads the Rico De Guzman-mentored White Team against the Red Team bannered by Grethcel Soltones in the featured charity match at 6:00 p.m. organized to raise funds for the benefit of Hero Foundation.You wont know what to expect in the games but for sure both teams will bring their A-games naman, said Morado. Kasi alam naman namin na hindi lang yun para sa amin, other than the fans, pati yung mga beneficiaries.Soltones is also expected to play with the same intensity and aggressiveness as she did when she carried BaliPure to the Open Conference throne.Siyempre laban pa rin ito, she said.Event starts at 1:30 p.m. with an autograph signing and photo ops with the volleyball stars for ringside and lower box ticket holders.The mens exhibition match begins at 3:30 p.m. and will air via livestream . The womens game will air live on ABS-CBN S+A Channel 23, ABS-CBN S+A HD Channel 166 and via livestream.Replay of the womens match is on Oc. 31 at 6:00 p.m. while playback of the mens game will be on Oct. 30 at 4:00 p.m. with replay on Nov. 2 at 6:00 p.m.Morado will have in her team Pocari Sweats Myla Pablo, Jeannette Panaga, Elaine Kasilag, Gyzelle Sy and libero Melissa Gohing, Isa Molde of University of the Philippines, Pau Soriano of Creamline, BanKo-Perlas Nicole Tiamzon and Suzanne Roces, Ateneos Bea De Leon and Joy Cases of Philippine Air Force.The Roger Gorayeb-mentored Team Red is composed of BaliPures Soltones, Jerrili Malabanan, Risa Sato, Jasmine Nabor, Aiko Urdas and Alyssa Eroa with Creamlines Cesca Racraquin, UPs Diana Carlos and BanKo-Perlas Kathy Bersola, Jem Ferrer and Amy Ahomiro.Playing in the mens division are Cignals Mark Alfafara, Lorenzo Capate, Rex Intal, Ysay Marasigan and Peter Torres for Blue Team to be handled by coach Oliver Almadro.Joining them are Ateneos Marck Espejo and Ish Polvorosa, Philippine Armys Jayvee Sumagaysay and Timothy Tajanlangit, National Us James Natividad and Instituto Estetico Manilas Rence Melgar.The Yellow Team of coach Rhovyl Verayo is composed of Philippine Air Forces Edwin Tolentino, Fauzi Ismail, Ranran Abdilla, Kim Malabunga and Rodolfo Labrador, Benjaylo Labide of Army, Vince Mangulabnan and Sandy Montero of Cignal, Francis Saura of Megabuilders and Sta. Elenas Rico Ramirez and Berlin Paglinawan.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: No holding back as stars collide in PVL All-Star Sunday

text: PVL Ahomiro joins Team Roger in PVL All-StarBanKo-Perlas' Amy Ahomiro gets a chance to play under former Ateneo de Manila University mentor Roger Gorayeb.BanKo-Perlas middle Amy Ahomiro reunites with former college coach Roger Gorayeb for the 2017 PVL All-Star Sunday on October 29 at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.The former Ateneo de Manila University standout is a late replacement for the Red Team that will be handled by Gorayeb in the leagues post-season special event set to raise funds for the benefit of Hero Foundation.Amohiro will fill in the spot left by Philippine Air Forces Iari Yongco in the exhibition match set to start at 6:00 p.m.The women's exhibition match will air live on ABS-CBN S+A Channel 23, ABS-CBN S+A HD Channel 166 and via livestream.The New Zealand native played for Gorayeb in her first couple of years in Ateneo De Manila University, honing her into one of UAAPs most dangerous middles, before the multi-titled mentor was replaced by Tai Bundit in 2013.Now back on the same team, Ahomiro will be one of Open Conference champion BaliPure coach Gorayebs main weapon against the White Team handled by Rico De Guzman of the Reinforce Conference titlist Pocari Sweat.Aside from Ahomiro, Alyssa Eroa will replace Water Defenders teammate Lizlee Ann Pantone as libero of Gorayebs team. Jaja Santiago of Collegiate Conference champion National University withdrew from participating in the event.Gorayeb will also bank on Creamlines Cesca Racraquin, BaliPures Grethcel Soltones, Jerrili Malabanan, Risa Sato, Jasmine Nabor, and Aiko Urdas, BanKo-Perlas Kathy Bersola and Jem Ferrer and Diana Carlos of UP.Top setter Jia Morado and Pau Soriano of the Cool Smashers banner the team of De Guzman with Pocari Sweat stars Myla Pablo, Gyzelle Sy, Jeanette Panaga, Elaine Kasilag and Mel Gohing, Banko-Perlas Nicole Tiamzon, who replaced injured Adamson player Jema Galanza, and Suzanne Roces, Joy Cases of Air Force, Isa Molde of University of the Philippines and Bea De Leon of Ateneo.Aside from the All-Star game, there will be a meet and greet event starting at 1:00 p.m. before the mens match at 3:30 p.m.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Ahomiro joins Team Roger in PVL All-Star

text: PVL PVL stars collide in All-Star Sunday on ABS-CBN S+APVL celebrates its first year with ABS-CBN S+A with an All-Star Sunday extravaganza for the fans.The Premier Volleyball League (PVL) wraps up a triumphant inaugural season on ABS-CBN S+A with an All Star Sunday on October 29 featuring the finest PVL stars led by the likes of 2017 Open Conference MVP Myla Pablo and 2017 Open Conference Best Setter Jia Morado in the womens division, and 2017 Collegiate Conference MVP Marck Espejo and 2017 Open Conference MVP Lorenzo Capate in the mens division.Volleyball fans can catch the action from the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan live on premiervolleyballleague.com starting at 4 pm. The womens exhibition match goes LIVE on ABS-CBN S+A and S+A HD at 6 pm, while the mens All-Star game will be telecast on Monday (October 30) at 4:00 p.m.The Womens Division will be split into two teams, with BaliPure Water Defenders head coach Roger Gorayeb taking the coaching duties for Red Team while Rico De Guzman of Pocari Sweat Lady Warriors will serve as White Teams coach for the Sunday spectacle.Grethcel Soltones (BaliPure), Jerrili Malabanan (BaliPure/FEU), Diana Carlos (UP), Ces Racraquin (Creamline/SBC), Risa Sato (BaliPure/NU), Kathy Bersola (Banko Perlas), Jasmine Nabor (BaliPure/NU), Jem Ferrer (Banko Perlas), Aiko Urdas (BaliPure/NU), Amy Ahomiro (Banko Perlas), and Alyssa Eroa (BaliPure) will be making up Gorayebs Red Team.Meanwhile, Pablo (Pocari Sweat), Morado (Creamline), Isa Molde (UP), Nicole Tiamzon (Banko Perlas), Joy Cases (PAF), Jeanette Panaga (Pocari Sweat), Pau Soriano (Creamline), Bea De Leon (ADMU), Gyzelle Sy (Pocari Sweat), Suzanne Roces (Banko Perlas), and Melissa Gohing (Pocari Sweat) will be De Guzmans wards for White Team.On the mens side, the players are split between Coach Oliver Almadros Blue Team and Vhyl Verayos Yellow Team. Espejo (Ateneo) is joined in the Blue team by Mark Alfafara (Cignal), Capate (Cignal), Jayvee Sumagaysay (Phil. Army/UST), Rex Intal (Cignal), Peter Torres (Cignal), Ish Polvorosa (Ateneo), Timothy Tajanlangit (Phil. Army/UST), James Natividad (NU), Ysay Marasigan (Cignal), Rence Melgar (IEM). Powering Yellow Team are Edwin Tolentino (Phil. Air Force), Fauzi, Ismail (PAF/ Megabuilders/NU, Alnakran Abdilla (Phil. Air Force), Benjaylo Labide (Phil. Army), Kim Malabunga (PAF/ Megabuilders/NU), Francis Philip Saura (Magabuilders/NU), Vince Mangulabnan (Cignal), Nico Ramirez (Sta. Elena), Berlin Paglinawan (Sta. Elena), Rudolfo Labrador (PAF) and Sandy Montero (Cignal).The All-Star Sunday is the culmination and celebration of the volleyball leagues inaugural season as players who participated in the 2017 Reinforced, Open, and Collegiate Conferences promise a massive treat to its fans. Festivities start off at 1pm with fans having the opportunity to get their idols autographs and will also feature performances by Star Music artists Miko and Gab, Yohan Hwang and Marlo Mortel.Dont miss the 2017 PVL All-Star Sunday on S+A, S+A HD and on premiervolleyballleague.com.For more information and stories, visit ABS-CBNs sports hub sports.abs-cbn.com and follow @ABSCBNSports on Facebook and Twitter.To be part of the conversation as the scintillating action goes on, post on social media using the hashtag #PVLonABSCBN.
title: PVL stars collide in All-Star Sunday on ABS-CBN S+A

text: PVL Espejo reunites with former Ateneo teammates in PVL All-StarCatch Ateneo de Manila University's Big Three reunion in the PVL All-Star Sunday 2017 at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.Four-time UAAP Most Valuable Player Marck Espejo and top setter Ish Polvorosa reunite with former Ateneo de Manila University teammates Rex Intal and Ysay Marasigan in the Premier Volleyball League All-Star Sunday on October 29 at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.Fans will once again see the four stars, who helped the Blue Eagles win three-straight UAAP titles, share the court and banner the Blue Team in the leagues end of season special event organized by Sports Vision for the benefit of Hero Foundation.Espejo and Polvorosa recently led Ateneo to claiming the PVLs inaugural Collegiate Conference crown while Intal and Marasigan bannered Cignals conquest of the Reinforced and Open conferences.Champion coach Oliver Almadro, who scored a historic grand slam by steering Cignal and Ateneo to the throne in each of the three conferences, will handle the Blue Team, which will face the Yellow Team of coach Rhovyl Verayo in the 3:30 p.m. exhibition match.Also playing for Blue Team are Cignals Mark Alfafara, Lorenzo Capate and Peter Torres, Philippine Armys Jayvee Sumagaysay and Timothy Tajanlangit, National Us James Natividad and Instituto Estetico Manilas Rence Melgar.The Yellow Team is composed of Philippine Air Forces Edwin Tolentino, Fauzi Ismail, Ranran Abdilla, Kim Malabunga and Rodolfo Labrador, Benjaylo Labide of Army, Vince Mangulabnan and Sandy Montero of Cignal, Francis Saura of Megabuilders and Sta. Elenas Rico Ramirez and Berlin Paglinawan.Event starts at 1:30 p.m. with an autograph signing and photo ops with the volleyball stars for ringside and lower box ticket holders.Action in the womens side is slated at 6:00 p.m. and will air live on ABS-CBN S+A Channel 23, ABS-CBN S+A HD Channel 166 and via livestream.Replay of the womens match is on Oc. 31 at 6:00 p.m. while playback of the mens game will be on Oct. 30 at 4:00 p.m. with replay on Nov. 2 at 6:00 p.m.Pocari Sweats Myla Pablo and Creamline setter Jia Morado lead the White Team coached by Rico De Guzman. Joining them are Isa Molde of University of the Philippines, Pocari Sweats Jeannette Panaga, Elaine Kasilag, Gyzelle Sy and libero Melissa Gohing, Pau Soriano of Creamline, BanKo-Perlas Nicole Tiamzon and Suzanne Roces, Ateneos Bea De Leon and Joy Cases of Philippine Air Force.The Roger Gorayeb-mentored Team Red is composed of Balipures Grethcel Soltones, Jerrili Malabana, Risa Sato, Jasmine Nabor, Aiko Urdas and Alyssa Eroa with Creamlines Cesca Racraquin, UPs Diana Carlos and BanKo-Perlas Kathy Bersola, Jem Ferrer and Amy Ahomiro.Tickets are available at the venue. Advance selling schedule is on Friday from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and on Saturday from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Espejo reunites with former Ateneo teammates in PVL All-Star

text: PVL PVL All-Star Sunday tickets now availableGet your PVL All-Star Sunday tickets at the FilOil Flying V Centre ticket booth in San Juan.Tickets for the Premier Volleyball League All-Star Sunday on October 29 are now available at the FilOil Flying V Centre ticket booth in San Juan.Patron tickets for the special end-of-season event are valued at P400 apiece, the premium lower box passes are P300 each while the lower box and bleachers tickets are sold at P200 and P50, respectively.The fun-filled and action-packed All-Star Sunday features the gathering of the leagues best players both in mens and womens divisions to play in a fund-raising exhibition match for the benefit of Hero Foundation.Event starts at 1:30 p.m. with an autograph signing and photo ops with the volleyball stars for ringside and lower box ticket holders.The mens exhibition match begins at 3:30 p.m. while action in the womens game is slated at 6:00 p.m. and will air live on ABS-CBN S+A Channel 23, ABS-CBN S+A HD Channel 166 and via livestream.Replay of the womens match is on Oc. 31 at 6:00 p.m. while playback of the mens game will be on Oct. 30 at 4:00 p.m. with replay on Nov. 2 at 6:00 p.m.Pocari Sweats Myla Pablo and Creamline setter Jia Morado lead the White Team coached by Rico De Guzman. Joining them are Isa Molde of University of the Philippines, Pocari Sweats Jeannette Panaga, Elaine Kasilag, Gyzelle Sy and libero Melissa Gohing, Pau Soriano of Creamline, BanKo-Perlas Nicole Tiamzon and Suzanne Roces, Ateneos Bea De Leon and Joy Cases of Philippine Air Force.The Roger Gorayeb-mentored Team Red is composed of Balipures Grethcel Soltones, Jerrili Malabana, Risa Sato, Jasmine Nabor, Aiko Urdas and Alyssa Eroa with Creamlines Cesca Racraquin, UPs Diana Carlos and BanKo-Perlas Kathy Bersola, Jem Ferrer and Amy Ahomiro.Playing in the mens division are Cignals Mark Alfafara, Lorenzo Capate, Rex Intal, Ysay Marasigan and Peter Torres for Blue Team to be handled by coach Oliver Almadro.Joining them are Ateneos Marck Espejo and Ish Polvorosa, Philippine Armys Jayvee Sumagaysay and Timothy Tajanlangit, National Us James Natividad and Instituto Estetico Manilas Rence Melgar.The Yellow Team of coach Rhovyl Verayo is composed of Philippine Air Forces Edwin Tolentino, Fauzi Ismail, Ranran Abdilla, Kim Malabunga and Rodolfo Labrador, Benjaylo Labide of Army, Vince Mangulabnan and Sandy Montero of Cignal, Francis Saura of Megabuilders and Sta. Elenas Rico Ramirez and Berlin Paglinawan.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: PVL All-Star Sunday tickets now available

text: PVL Sobrang fulfilling siya for us -- Morado on successful PVL on TourCreamline stars Cesca Racraquin and Jia Morado enjoyed their stint in the highly successful PVL on Tour Visayas leg held early this week in Iloilo and Bacolod.Fulfilling and fun.This was the how Creamline star setter Jia Morado and Cesca Racraquin described their experience playing in the Premier Volleyball League (PVL) on Tour when the event visited Iloilo and Bacolod early this week.After the Luzon leg of the event held in Tuguegarao and Batangas City, fans in the Visayas were given a great volleyball treat from the countrys brightest and most popular court stars.Its tiring but really fulfilling kasi minsan lang kami makaikot ng bansa eh, said Morado, who teamed up with former Ateneo de Manila University Queen Eagle Alyssa Valdez once again starting in the Batangas leg of the event as the Phenom got a short break on her Attack Line stint in Taiwan.In the Bacolod leg last Wednesday held at the University of St. La Salle gym, Valdez, Racraquin and Morado led the Cool Smashers to a four-set demolition of Pocari Sweat, 25-23, 23-25, 25-16, 25-16, and bounce back from a 21-25, 25-22, 7-25, 14-25, loss to BanKo-Perlas the day before in Iloilo.Morado added that shes happy with the initiative of league organizer Sports Vision and Grid Athletic Sports, a group that included Beach Volleyball Republic founder Charo Soriano, to put up the PVL on Tour as a chance for players to reach out to their volleyball fans all over the country.Parang when we play the only way we could reach them is trough TV but now they're able to watch us play live, Morado said. Tapos ang mga meet and greet din na nami-meet namin ang mga taong sumusuporta sa amin. At the end of the day sobrang fulfilling siya for us.Racraquin for her part admitted that that the travel was a bit exhausting but seeing the smiles on their fans faces was all worth it.Unang-una nakakapagod. Exhausting pero super saya kasi ang dami naming napasayang tao and at the same time nakapag-travel kami as a team. Nakapag-bonding kami, she said.In other results of the Visayan PVL on Tour visit, Pocari Sweat shot down Philippine Air Force, 25-20, 25-21, 16-25, 23-25, 15-10, in Iloilo while BanKo-Perlas bested the Jet Spikers, 20-25, 25-11, 25-16, 25-17.Morado and Racraquin will go up against each other in the next PVL event set on October 29 at the FilOil Flying V Centre in San Juan.The Creamline playmaker will be donning the colors of the team that will be handled by coach Rico De Guzman against Racraquins squad under seasoned mentor Roger Gorayeb in the 2017 PVL All-Star Sunday.Helping Morado are Pocari Sweat stars Myla Pablo, Gyzelle Sy, Jeanette Panaga, Elaine Kasilag and Mel Gohing, Banko-Perlas Nicole Tiamzon and Suzanne Roces, Joy Cases of Air Force, Pau Soriano of Creamline, Isa Molde of University of the Philippines and Bea De Leon of Ateneo.On Racraquins side are BaliPures Grethcel Soltones, Jerrili Malabanan, Risa Sato, Jasmine Nabor, Aiko Urdas and Alyssa Eroa, BanKo-Perlas Amy Ahomiro, Kathy Bersola and Jem Ferrer and Diana Carlos of UP.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Sobrang fulfilling siya for us -- Morado on successful PVL on Tour

text: PVL Valdez gives home province fans a treat in PVL on TourAlyssa Valdez endured a long and exhausting travel to give her fans who trooped to Batangas City Coliseum a volleyball treat.Volleyball star Alyssa Valdez gave avid fans from her home province of Batangas City a treat Sunday night, despite a long and exhausting trip from Iloilo as she bannered Creamline to a heart-stopping win in the second leg of the PVL on Tour.Valdez led the Cool Smashers to a 17-25, 18-25, 25-17, 25-23, 19-17 win over BanKo-Perlas in the exhibition match held at the Batangas City Coliseum.The former Ateneo Queen Eagle, who hails from San Juan, Batangas, smashed the match-clinching kill to seal the magical night that left the crowd leaving the venue with smile on their faces.Valdez, who took a brief break from her duties with Chinese Taipei club Attack Line just to attend the PVL on Tour, endured an exhausting travel from Iloilo to Batangas City.She was supposed to fly to Manila from Iloilo on Oct. 13 at 10:30 p.m., but her flight was cancelled. Valdez had to travel by ferry to Bacolod and found a flight at 2:00 p.m. After arriving in Manila, she immediately travelled to Batangas City.In the only other game, Myla Pablo spearheaded Pocari Sweat to a 17-25, 27-25, 16-25, 26-24, 15-5 win over a Grethcel Soltones-led Bali Pure.Valdez is scheduled to play when the PVL on Tour visits Iloilo on Oct. 17 and Bacolod on Oct. 18.
title: Valdez gives home province fans a treat in PVL on Tour

text: PVL Lady Bulldogs trust new systemHappy ako na dito sa PVL nakuha namin ang sistema na gusto talaga ni coach para sa amin. Tingin ko sobrang malaking maitutulong nito for the team.National Universitys dominating championship run in the Premier Volleyball League Collegiate Conference is a testament that the Lady Bulldogs are already adapting to a new system under head coach Babes Castillo.Just a few months since assuming the post left by Roger Gorayeb last summer after the 79th Season of the UAAP, Castillo was able to slowly guide the squad under his system and bring fresh brand of play for NU.The PVL was his testing ground and the Lady Bulldogs delivered.NU swept all of its nine games in the tournament including an emphatic demolition of Far Eastern University in the best-of-three Finals series.Six-foot-5 veteran Jaja Santiago, Risa Sato, a healthier Aiko Urdas and Jorelle Singh, third year setter Jasmine Nabor and top libero Gayle Valdez responded well with Castillos system.Even with a new coach the Lady Bulldogs were able to collect their third straight Collegiate Conference title since winning the defunct V-Leagues last two editions in 2015 and 2016.Sabi nga namin, ang natutunan ko sa conference na ito is a matter of respect and mag-jive kami sa bagong sistema na ini-implement sa amin, said Santiago, who won the Conference Most Valuable Player award. Natutuwa ako kasi lahat kami sumunod doon and lahat kami nakuha namin yun.Castillo is the graduating Santiagos fourth coach in her five-year collegiate career. She was coached by Francis Vicente during her rookie year before going under the guidance of Dong Dela Cruz and Roger Gorayeb in the next three years.So adapting to a new system isn't new to her.Natutunan ko na wala namang mawawala kung susundin ko ang bagong sistema and mamahalin namin kung ano ang meron kami ngayon, she said. Happy ako na dito sa PVL nakuha namin ang sistema na gusto talaga ni coach para sa amin. Tingin ko sobrang malaking maitutulong nito for the team.The championship is a big boost for NU as the Lady Bulldogs prepare for the most important battle when the 80th UAAP tournament rolls early next year.NU has a two-year UAAP Final Four drought.Pagtatrabahuhan po talaga namin na makarating ng championship ngayong UAAP kasi yun po talaga ang goal naming, said Nabor, named Finals MVP. Kumabaga last UAAP po yun po ang plano namin pero may mga kulang pa po.Parang simula ngayon hanggang mag-UAAP na pagtatrabahuhan po namin ang mga dapat naming pagtrabahuhan para makuha po namin ang goal naming, she added.Sisiguraduhin po namin na nasa maayos kami na preparasyon, Santiago seconded.---Follow this writer on Twitter, @fromtheriles
title: Lady Bulldogs trust new system
